sidebar.dashboardTooltip: Monitor system overview, API status, and recent analysis results in real-time. View registered API list and health status at a glance.
sidebar.guideTooltip: Access system usage guides, tutorials, and step-by-step instructions. Includes quick start guide and feature overview for new users.
sidebar.analyzeTooltip: Upload actual drawing images to run the integrated pipeline. Automatically performs the complete process: YOLO detection ‚Üí OCR extraction ‚Üí tolerance analysis.
sidebar.testTooltip: Test individual APIs in detail. Adjust parameters, inspect request/response, and debug. For developers and advanced users.
sidebar.blueprintflowTooltip: Visual workflow builder. Create custom analysis pipelines by connecting nodes with drag-and-drop. (Beta feature)
sidebar.blueprintflowBuilderTooltip: Create visual workflows with drag-and-drop. Freely connect 9 node types (YOLO, eDOCr2, EDGNet, SkinModel, PaddleOCR, VL, IF, Loop, Merge).
sidebar.blueprintflowListTooltip: Manage and execute saved workflows. Save, edit, delete, and run created workflows instantly.
sidebar.blueprintflowTemplatesTooltip: Pre-defined workflow template gallery. Use 4 templates immediately: Basic OCR, Advanced Analysis, Loop Processing, Multi-model Ensemble.
sidebar.monitorTooltip: Monitor system resources (CPU, GPU, Memory, Disk) and performance metrics in real-time. Track API response time, throughput, and error rate.
sidebar.adminTooltip: System administrator page. Provides API registration/modification/deletion, user permission management, system settings, and log viewing.
sidebar.docsTooltip: Access API specifications, technical documentation, and developer guides. Check all documents including installation guide, troubleshooting, and BlueprintFlow usage.
sidebar.projectManagementTooltip: Manage BOM-based projects. Upload drawings, batch analysis, quotation aggregation, and HITL verification.
sidebar.projectManagementDesc: BOM ‚Üí Drawing Match ‚Üí AI Analysis ‚Üí Quotation
sidebar.settingsTooltip: Manage user preferences. Change language (Korean/English), theme (light/dark), notifications, and more.
sidebar.quickTestTooltip: Quick access to frequently used APIs. Shortcut links for instant testing without detailed configuration.
sidebar.gatewayTooltip: Test the complete integrated pipeline. Executes end-to-end analysis combining multiple APIs. Most recommended testing method.
sidebar.yoloTooltip: Test YOLOv11 object detection AI model. Automatically detects dimension lines, arrows, text, etc. in engineering drawings. (GPU accelerated)
sidebar.edocr2Tooltip: Test eDOCr v1/v2 Korean OCR engine. Precisely extracts dimensions, GD&T symbols, and text from drawings. (GPU accelerated)
sidebar.edgnetTooltip: Test EDGNet drawing segmentation model. Segments drawings by region to analyze structure. (GPU accelerated)
sidebar.skinmodelTooltip: Test SkinModel tolerance analysis engine. Evaluates manufacturability and generates quotes based on extracted dimension information.
sidebar.vlTooltip: Test Vision-Language multimodal AI. Performs advanced analysis by processing drawing images and natural language queries together. (LLM-based)

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Monitor real-time API status and system health.
dashboard.apiTestsDesc: Test individual APIs and check their responses.
dashboard.monitorDesc: Monitor system resources and performance metrics.

docs.title: üìö Project Documentation
docs.subtitle: Browse and search all project documentation
docs.selectDocument: Select a document from the left

blueprintflow.title: BlueprintFlow
blueprintflow.builderSubtitle: Compose drawing analysis workflows like LEGO blocks with drag & drop
blueprintflow.workflowBuilderDesc: Create your own drawing analysis pipeline by placing and connecting API nodes like YOLO, eDOCr2, EDGNet on a visual canvas.
blueprintflow.designDocsDesc: Complete architecture design ready for LLM developers.
blueprintflow.createFirstWorkflow: Create your first workflow in Workflow Builder.
blueprintflow.templatesSubtitle: Get started quickly with verified workflow templates
blueprintflow.completeAnalysisDesc: Full pipeline: ESRGAN upscale + detection + OCR Ensemble + tolerance analysis + VL AI description
blueprintflow.accuracyPipelineDesc: YOLO ‚Üí EDGNet ‚Üí eDOCr2 + PaddleOCR dual OCR parallel processing
blueprintflow.speedPipelineDesc: Minimal node configuration for fastest analysis (3-5 seconds)
blueprintflow.basicOCRDesc: Basic workflow: YOLO detection ‚Üí OCR ‚Üí tolerance analysis
blueprintflow.ocrEnsembleDesc: ESRGAN image enhancement + 4-engine ensemble voting OCR
blueprintflow.multiOCRComparisonDesc: Compare results from eDOCr2, PaddleOCR, Tesseract, TrOCR engines
blueprintflow.vlAssistedDesc: Intelligent pipeline using Vision-Language AI to understand and analyze drawings
blueprintflow.knowledgeEnhancedDesc: Context-aware analysis using Knowledge engine for drawing knowledge search
blueprintflow.conditionalOCRDesc: Automatic fast/precise OCR branching based on detection confidence
blueprintflow.loopDetectionDesc: Process each detection region individually for maximum OCR accuracy
blueprintflow.pidAnalysisDesc: Complete P&ID analysis with symbol detection, line detection, connectivity analysis, and design validation
blueprintflow.completeAnalysisUseCase: Best for final delivery review, detailed analysis reports for clients, and when accuracy matters more than speed.
blueprintflow.pidAnalysisUseCase: Use for chemical/petrochemical plant P&ID reviews, automatic BOM generation, and design compliance verification.
blueprintflow.speedPipelineUseCase: Ideal for batch processing, quick previews, and demos. Choose this when speed is more important than accuracy.
blueprintflow.basicOCRUseCase: Recommended starting point for mechanical drawing analysis. Perfect for beginners or standard workflow needs.
blueprintflow.accuracyPipelineUseCase: Use for complex drawings or noisy scanned images. Dual OCR cross-validation increases reliability.
blueprintflow.ocrEnsembleUseCase: Effective for low-resolution, damaged, or handwriting-mixed drawings. 4-engine voting achieves highest accuracy.
blueprintflow.multiOCRComparisonUseCase: Use for OCR engine benchmarking, testing new drawing types, or analyzing engine-specific strengths.
blueprintflow.fullOCRBenchmarkDesc: Run all 8 OCR engines simultaneously for side-by-side comparison. Includes eDOCr2, PaddleOCR, Tesseract, TrOCR, Surya, DocTR, EasyOCR, and Ensemble.
blueprintflow.fullOCRBenchmarkUseCase: Use to find the optimal OCR for new drawing types, benchmark engine performance, or evaluate which OCR works best for specific drawings.
blueprintflow.detectionBenchmarkDesc: Compare YOLO model performance with various settings (model_type, confidence, resolution).
blueprintflow.detectionBenchmarkUseCase: Use to select optimal detection model for general drawings vs P&ID drawings, or evaluate performance differences by confidence and resolution settings.
blueprintflow.segmentationBenchmarkDesc: Compare EDGNet (edge segmentation) vs Line Detector (line detection) using LSD/Hough methods.
blueprintflow.segmentationBenchmarkUseCase: Use to select appropriate segmentation method for structural analysis, or compare edge-based vs line-based approaches.
blueprintflow.analysisBenchmarkDesc: Run all 3 analysis engines simultaneously: SkinModel (tolerance), PID Analyzer (connectivity), Design Checker (validation).
blueprintflow.analysisBenchmarkUseCase: Use for comprehensive analysis of mechanical and P&ID drawings, or evaluate tolerance/connectivity/design rules together.
blueprintflow.preprocessingBenchmarkDesc: Compare how Original vs ESRGAN 2x vs ESRGAN 4x upscaling affects OCR accuracy.
blueprintflow.preprocessingBenchmarkUseCase: Use to find optimal preprocessing for low-resolution drawings, or evaluate quality vs processing time trade-offs by upscale ratio.
blueprintflow.aiBenchmarkDesc: Apply 3 different prompts (description, dimension extraction, issue analysis) to VL model and compare response quality.
blueprintflow.aiBenchmarkUseCase: Use to find optimal prompts for drawing analysis goals, or explore various VL model applications.
blueprintflow.vlAssistedUseCase: Best when overall context understanding is needed, for unstructured analysis requests, or natural language Q&A.
blueprintflow.knowledgeEnhancedUseCase: Use for GD&T symbol interpretation, standard reference lookup, or searching similar historical drawings.
blueprintflow.conditionalOCRUseCase: Optimal for batch processing drawings with inconsistent quality. Auto-routes clear areas fast, unclear areas precisely.
blueprintflow.loopDetectionUseCase: Use when each detected region needs individual analysis, detailed per-section results, or large drawing zone processing.
blueprintflow.templatesExplanation: Each template saves a verified workflow configuration in JSON format. You can load templates in Workflow Builder to modify or run as-is.
blueprintflow.saveTooltip: Save current workflow to local storage
blueprintflow.clearTooltip: Clear all nodes and edges from canvas
blueprintflow.containersNotRunningDesc: The following services are stopped and cannot execute the workflow:
blueprintflow.containersStartHint: Start services from Dashboard or click the button below to start automatically.
blueprintflow.loadTemplateTooltip: Load a saved template into the workflow
blueprintflow.saveAsTemplateTooltip: Save current workflow as a reusable template
blueprintflow.techcrossBwmsChecklistDesc: BWMS P&ID checklist validation - 60 items auto-verification with ECS/HYCHLOR product-specific rules
blueprintflow.techcrossBwmsChecklistUseCase: Automatically validates 60 checklist items during BWMS design review and calculates compliance rate. Product-specific rules are applied for ECS/HYCHLOR systems.
blueprintflow.techcrossValveSignalDesc: Valve signal list generation - Control/Isolation/Safety/Check/Relief classification with confidence-based verification
blueprintflow.techcrossValveSignalUseCase: Automatically detects valves from P&ID drawings and classifies them into 5 categories (Control/Isolation/Safety/Check/Relief). Exports to Excel after Human-in-the-Loop verification.
blueprintflow.techcrossEquipmentListDesc: AI BOM-based equipment list - Human-in-the-Loop verification UI for ECU/FMU/HGU detection and quantity aggregation
blueprintflow.techcrossEquipmentListUseCase: Detects equipment from P&ID using YOLO and verifies through AI BOM Human-in-the-Loop UI (localhost:3000). Verified equipment quantities are auto-aggregated and exported to TECHCROSS Equipment List Excel format.
blueprintflow.techcrossDeviationDesc: AI BOM-based deviation analysis - Human-in-the-Loop review of ISO 10628/ISA 5.1/BWMS deviations with severity adjustment
blueprintflow.techcrossDeviationUseCase: Analyzes P&ID deviations and reviews through AI BOM verification UI (localhost:3000) with Human-in-the-Loop approach. Adjust severity (Critical/High/Medium/Low/Info), filter false positives, and export to Deviation List.
blueprintflow.dseBearingAnalysis: DSE Bearing 1-1: Drawing Analysis + AI BOM
blueprintflow.dseBearingAnalysisDesc: Mechanical drawing dimension/tolerance recognition - YOLO + eDOCr2 + SkinModel + Human-in-the-Loop verification
blueprintflow.dseBearingAnalysisUseCase: Detects dimension lines from turbine bearing drawings, extracts dimensions/tolerances via OCR, then verifies through AI BOM Human-in-the-Loop UI. Verified data is exported to BOM Excel format.
blueprintflow.dseBearingRingAssyDesc: Tilting Pad(T1-T3)/Elliptical(T4-T8) Bearing Ring Assembly - Up to 19 parts BOM + Babbitt lining clearance analysis
blueprintflow.dseBearingRingAssyUseCase: Extracts BOM table from T1-T8 series bearing ring assembly drawings. Auto-recognizes SF440A/SF45A material rings, Babbitt lining (clearance 0.005-0.03mm), DOWEL PINs, HEX BOLTs and other components.
blueprintflow.dseBearingCasingAssyDesc: Bearing Casing Assembly - Upper/Lower Split structure, oil port/thread machining extraction
blueprintflow.dseBearingCasingAssyUseCase: Extracts split upper/lower structure, oil ports (1/8"-27NPT, 1/2"-14NPT), thread machining (M8-M30), Oil Thrower, temperature holder from Bearing Casing assembly drawings.
blueprintflow.dseThrustBearingDesc: Thrust Bearing Assembly (TBN/GEN Side) - 12 PADs, Leveling Plates, PIVOT analysis
blueprintflow.dseThrustBearingUseCase: Extracts 12 thrust pads, upper/lower leveling plates, PIVOTs, Babbitt lining (ASTM B23 GR.2), torque specs (M16: 1178-1302Nm) from Thrust Bearing assembly drawings.
blueprintflow.dseBearingYoloPartsListExtract: DSE Bearing 2-8: YOLO-Based Parts List Extraction
blueprintflow.dseBearingYoloPartsListExtractDesc: YOLO ‚Üí Table Detector pipeline - Detects text_block regions then extracts table structure (overcomes TATR detection limits)
blueprintflow.dseBearingYoloPartsListExtractUseCase: YOLO detects text_block regions (Parts List tables) in drawings first, then Table Detector processes only those regions for accurate table structure extraction. Effectively handles mechanical drawing Parts Lists that TATR cannot detect directly. Test results: Accurate extraction of 15 rows √ó 3 columns of parts (RING UPPER, HEX SOCKET, etc.).
blueprintflow.dseBearingFullQuoteDesc: Title Block ‚Üí Parts List ‚Üí Dimension ‚Üí BOM Matcher ‚Üí Quote Generator ‚Üí Excel quotation auto-generation
blueprintflow.dseBearingFullQuoteUseCase: Fully automated pipeline from drawing to quotation. Extracts title block info (drawing number, revision, part name, material), parts list (part number, description, quantity), dimensions (OD/ID, tolerances, GD&T), matches BOM, calculates quote with material and labor costs, and exports to Excel quotation format.
blueprintflow.panasiaMcpPanelBom: PANASIA: MCP Panel Symbol Detection + GT Comparison
blueprintflow.panasiaMcpPanelBomDesc: 27-class symbol detection ‚Üí GT comparison ‚Üí Approve/Reject/Modify ‚Üí Canvas manual add ‚Üí BOM export
blueprintflow.panasiaMcpPanelBomUseCase: Detects 27 symbol types (CB, TR, CT, PT, LA, etc.) from PANASIA MCP Panel drawings using bom_detector model. Compare with GT (Ground Truth) in 3-way view: detected symbol / GT value / original image. Approve/reject/modify, manually add missed symbols on Canvas, then export final BOM. Sample: sample7_mcp_panel_body.jpg

fileUpload.sampleLoadFailed: An error occurred while loading sample file.

guide.title: üìö AX Project Guide
guide.subtitle: Complete architecture and usage guide for BlueprintFlow-based flexible API composition system
guide.projectDescription: This project is a microservice-based system that automatically extracts dimensions, GD&T, tolerances, etc. from engineering drawings. BlueprintFlow allows you to freely combine and compare various APIs.
guide.docDescription: All documentation is organized into 7 categories by purpose.
guide.blueprintflowSubtitle: Visual workflow builder - Compose API pipelines with drag and drop
guide.conditionalBranchDesc: "Use eDOCr2 if YOLO detects objects, otherwise use PaddleOCR"

analyze.title: Drawing Analysis
analyze.subtitle: Upload drawings to perform OCR, segmentation, and tolerance analysis.
analyze.integratedInfo1: This page performs all analysis at once through the Gateway API
analyze.integratedInfo2: Image files (JPG, PNG) recommended when using segmentation option
analyze.integratedInfo3: PDF files only support OCR and tolerance analysis
analyze.integratedInfo4: Use the Test menu for individual API testing
analyze.uploadPrompt: Upload a file to start analysis
analyze.uploadInstruction: Select a file from the left, configure analysis options, and execute

monitor.title: Real-time Monitoring
monitor.subtitle: Monitor API performance, GPU status, and system resources in real-time. (Auto-refresh every 5 seconds)

addApiDialog.title: Add New API
addApiDialog.warningMessage: API backend server must be running with a health check endpoint (/api/v1/health). After adding, it will be automatically reflected in Dashboard, Settings, and BlueprintFlow.
addApiDialog.apiIdHelper: Lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens allowed (e.g., text-classifier, ocr-v3)
addApiDialog.apiNameHelper: Used as variable name. Letters, numbers, and underscores allowed

errors.idInvalid: API ID must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens
errors.nameInvalid: API name must contain only letters, numbers, and underscores
errors.baseUrlInvalid: Invalid URL format (must start with http:// or https://)

quote.title: Quotation
quote.validityNote: * This quotation is valid for 30 days from the issue date.
quote.deliveryNote: * Delivery: 4-6 weeks after order (subject to negotiation)
